chapter.title: Timestamp Functions
chapter.para: Each timestamp function returns a value to indicate when the function is executed. Thus, these returned values can be used to indicate when an event occurs, provide an ordering for events, or compute the amount of time elapsed between to time stamps.

formalpara.title: get_cycles:long()
formalpara.para: Return the processor cycle counter value, or 0 if unavailable.

formalpara.title: gettimeofday_ns:long ()
formalpara.para: Return the number of nanoseconds since the UNIX epoch.

formalpara.title: gettimeofday_us:long ()
formalpara.para: Return the number of microseconds since the UNIX epoch.

formalpara.title: gettimeofday_ms:long ()
formalpara.para: Return the number of milliseconds since the UNIX epoch.

formalpara.title: gettimeofday_s:long ()
formalpara.para: Return the number of seconds since the UNIX epoch.
